intro: Actinostemon concolor var. variifolius, commonly known as the variable-leaf actinostemon, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its striking, lance-shaped leaves that vary in color and texture across different parts of the plant. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, adding to its ornamental value. Native to tropical regions, it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its unique foliage, it is often cultivated as a decorative plant in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
